Bolo India: A crowdsourcing initiative f: Bolo India: A crowdsourcing initiative for Indian languages
India needs to be Atma Nirbhar in the ar: India needs to be Atma Nirbhar in the area of speech recognition in Indian languages. Hence, we want to create an open data repository of many Indian voices. This is an effort by MeitY, Government of India, under the National Language Translation Mission (NLTM). This effort is supported by EkStep Foundation on a pro-bono basis and leverages its open source work under sunbird.org along with various other open source frameworks.
Bolo India invites you to volunteer and: Bolo India invites you to volunteer and contribute your voice for this cause. All your contributions are automatically processed and made available as open data in a useful fashion back to the community. Such data then can be used by all language enthusiasts and technologists to develop world class speech recognition applications.
India is a land of many languages, our d: India is a land of many languages, our digital strategy must reflect it.
90% of India's population uses regional: 90% of India's population uses regional languages to conduct their day-to-day activities.
As more and more people use digital plat: As more and more people use digital platforms for financial, educational and social activities, digital platforms must work seamlessly in all Indian Languages.
We need to build speech recognition tech: We need to build speech recognition technologies that are tuned for your language.  It must have high accuracy and understand the daily language and communications of people in your language.
Having open world class speech recogniti: Having open world class speech recognition in your language will enable a digital first model in your language in various sectors such as: education, healthcare and media.
The tools, utilities and models propose: The tools, utilities and models  proposed to be developed in your language will rely on open source contributions through Bolo India crowd sourcing platform
Speech recognition relies on \"machine-l: Speech recognition relies on "machine-learning" technology that requires large datasets that include diverse voices and the corresponding text. Through Bolo India, we want to create a diverse open repository of Indian voices speaking Indian languages which can be used for this initiative
This is where you come in.
We are inviting you to join us and volun: We are inviting you to join us and voluntarily contribute your voice to this initiative. Recording your voice at one stretch can be overwhelming hence you can do this by visiting the website multiple times and commence from where you left us off
Every minute of your contribution will m: Every minute of your contribution will make a huge difference and bring us closer to our objective.
EkStep Foundation gathers partners and c: EkStep Foundation gathers partners and creates open infrastructure, tools and frameworks to solve complex societal problems at scale. We do this by leveraging the open source digital infrastructure we have created called Sunbird and by following a way of thinking and doing called the Societal Platform Approach.
EkStep is a not-for-profit organization: EkStep is a not-for-profit organization founded by Rohini and Nandan Nilekani and Shankar Maruwada.

India needs to be Aatmanirbhar in the ar: India needs to be Aatmanirbhar in the area of speech recognition in Indian languages.  Hence, we want to create an open data repository of many Indian voices. Bolo India invites you to volunteer contribute your voice for this cause.
The key to building speech recognition m: The key to building speech recognition models, lies in the diversity of the data that you provide by contributing across states, dialects, accents, gender and age group. The magnitude of this diversity across the nation, gives us collective strength in empowering our languages.

Crowdsourcing Platform is a Government I: Crowdsourcing Platform is a Government Initiative to build an open data repository for all Indian languages.
The participation is purely voluntary. T: The participation is purely voluntary. The contributions made by you will be stored in the repo without any personal info. This data will be then made available to  technologists & language enthusiasts to help develop software and apps in Indian  languages, thus making them available to every Indian citizen.

A Crowdsourcing initiative for Indian La: A Crowdsourcing initiative for Indian Languages
[Bhaashini] aims to create open datasets: [Bhaashini] aims to create open datasets to develop Speech Recognition, Text-to-Speech, Machine Translation and Optical Character Recognition for Indian languages. This initiative will empower our technologists, language enthusiasts and language communities to build world class digital applications in our own local languages.
Help Indian languages become atma-nirbha: Help Indian languages become atma-nirbhar through these datasets.
Help create open repository of Speech Re: Help create open repository of Speech Recognition data, Parallel translations and Labeled Images.
Engaging with this platform will win you: Engaging with this platform will win you badges and pride for building the data in local Languages
Contribute just 5 sentences in your lang: Contribute just 5 sentences in your languages
This is an effort by MeitY, Government o: This is an effort by MeitY, Government of India, under the National Language Translation Mission (NLTM). This effort is supported by EkStep Foundation on a pro-bono basis and leverages its open source work under https://sunbird.org/projects/vakyansh along with various other open source frameworks.
We need to build speech recognition, tex: We need to build speech recognition, text-to-speech, machine translation and OCR technologies that are tuned for your language.
These technologies will transform your l: These technologies will transform your language to become "digital first" in various sectors such as: education, healthcare and media.
The tools, utilities and models proposed: The tools, utilities and models proposed to be developed in your language will rely on open source contributions through the Bhaashini crowd sourcing platform
The above mentioned technologies rely on: The above mentioned technologies rely on AI technology that requires large datasets in their respective fields.
[Bhaashini] currently has four crowdsouc: [Bhaashini] currently has four crowdsoucing initiatives to create these datasets
Bolo India creates a repository of diver: Bolo India creates a repository of diverse voices speaking Indian languages, where volunteer reads the corresponding text.
Suno India creates an open dataset throu: Suno India creates an open dataset through transcription of audio files.
Likho India creates open parallel transl: Likho India creates open parallel translation datasets between corresponding sentences in two languages.
Dekho India creates an open data reposit: Dekho India creates an open data repository of images and the corresponding text.
We are inviting you to join us and volun: We are inviting you to join us and voluntarily contribute to this initiative. Contributing at one stretch can be overwhelming hence you can do this by visiting the website multiple times and commence from where you left us off.
Enrich Indian languages become atma-nirb: Enrich Indian languages become atma-nirbhar through these datasets.
Enrich create open repository of Speech: Enrich create open repository of Speech Recognition data, Parallel translations and Labeled Images.
